concise_definition: v. 击败, 战胜, 击溃 (第三人称单数形式)

definitions.explanation_en: To overcome an opponent in a contest, competition, or conflict, resulting in their loss or failure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在比赛、竞争或冲突中战胜对手，使其失败或落败。
definitions.example_en: The home team defeats their rivals 3-1 in the final match.
definitions.example_cn: 主队在决赛中以3比1击败了对手。

definitions.explanation_en: To prevent someone from achieving a goal or succeeding, often through strategic or forceful action.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过策略性或强制性手段阻止某人实现目标或取得成功。
definitions.example_en: Strong security measures defeated the hackers' attempt to breach the system.
definitions.example_cn: 强大的安全措施挫败了黑客入侵系统的企图。

definitions.explanation_en: A victory or win over an opponent; the act or result of defeating someone.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对对手的胜利或战胜行为；击败他人的行为或结果。
definitions.example_en: The team celebrated every defeat of their long-time rivals.
definitions.example_cn: 球队为每一次战胜长期对手而庆祝。

comparison.analysis: “Win” (获胜) 是一个更通用的词，泛指在任何竞争中取得胜利，不强调对手的失败过程。而 “defeat” 更强调主动击败或战胜某个具体的对手，带有更强的对抗性和征服意味。例如，你可以说 “win a game”，但必须说 “defeat an opponent”。
“Overcome” (克服) 通常用于克服困难、障碍或情绪，如 overcome fear 或 overcome adversity，强调内在或抽象挑战的战胜。而 “defeat” 更常用于具体的人、组织或实体之间的对抗，如 defeat an army 或 defeat a plan。
“Beat” (打败) 是 “defeat” 的非正式同义词，语义相近，但更口语化、简洁。两者在大多数语境中可互换，但 “defeat” 更正式、更常用于书面语和新闻报道中，而 “beat” 更适合日常对话。例如：He beat me at chess. / He defeated me at chess. 两者都正确，但后者更庄重。
